comment:
* Contains message parts.
         *
         * To avoid issues where applications might cache a part ID, the ID of a deleted part must
         * not be reused to point at a new part.

variables.name: CONTENT_URI
variables.comment:
* The {@code content://} style URL for this table. Can be appended with a part ID to
             * address individual parts.

variables.name: MSG_ID
variables.comment:
* The identifier of the message which this part belongs to. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: SEQ
variables.comment:
* The order of the part. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CONTENT_TYPE
variables.comment:
* The content type of the part. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: NAME
variables.comment:
* The name of the part. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: CHARSET
variables.comment:
* The charset of the part. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: FILENAME
variables.comment:
* The file name of the part. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: CONTENT_DISPOSITION
variables.comment:
* The content disposition of the part. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: CONTENT_ID
variables.comment:
* The content ID of the part. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CONTENT_LOCATION
variables.comment:
* The content location of the part. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CT_START
variables.comment:
* The start of content-type of the message. *

Type: INTEGER

variables.name: CT_TYPE
variables.comment:
* The type of content-type of the message. *

Type: TEXT

variables.name: _DATA
variables.comment:
* The location (on filesystem) of the binary data of the part. *

Type: INTEGER

methods.name: public static Uri getPartUriForMessage(@NonNull String messageId)
methods.comment:
* Generates a Part {@link Uri} for message, used to perform Part table operation
             * for mms.
             *
             * @param messageId the messageId used to generate Part {@link Uri} dynamically
             * @return the partUri used to perform Part table operation for mms

methodNames: public static Uri getPartUriForMessage(@NonNull String messageId)
